By contrast, tribal morality is prescriptive, imposing the norms of the collective on the individual. [[Moralism]] is the belief that morals are instilled in humans whether by God or society and therefore should mandate a person's actions. Moralism further holds the belief that there is only what can be proven, and therefore, while they do not deny God, they also do no believe in one. Like atheism however, Moralism stresses the study in science and appreciation of the earthly beauties help one accomplish a truly meaningful life.
